com.noctarius.borabora

Class Predicates

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.noctarius.borabora.Predicates

  • public final class Predicates
extends Object
    The Predicates class contains parsing optimized utility methods to provide Predicate matchers against Dictionary keys or values or Sequence values. The methods provided here can be passed to the following dictionary, sequence or query methods:
    • Dictionary.containsKey(Predicate)
    • Dictionary.containsValue(Predicate)
    • QueryTokenBuilder.dictionary(Predicate)
    • QueryTokenBuilder.sequenceMatch(Predicate)
    See Also:
    Dictionary, Sequence, QueryTokenBuilder, Predicate

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods

      Matches any given Value

      Matches any kind of floating point data type (float, double, BigDecimal against the provided value.
      static Predicate<Value> matchInt(long value)
      Matches any kind of integer data type (byte, short, int, long or BigInteger against the provided value.
      static Predicate<Value> matchString(String value)
      Matches strings against the provided value with case sensitivity.
      static Predicate<Value> matchStringIgnoreCase(String value)
      Matches strings against the provided value with ignored case sensitivity.

    • Method Detail

      • any

        public static final Predicate<Value> any()
        Matches any given Value
        Returns:
        always true

      • matchStringIgnoreCase

        public static Predicate<Value> matchStringIgnoreCase(String value)
        Matches strings against the provided value with ignored case sensitivity. Anyhow as an optimization, the given value at first is tried to be matched in a case sensitive mode in case the stream actually matches directly (see matchString(String) for further details). Only afterwards the string from the stream is actually deserialized and matched using String.equalsIgnoreCase(String).
        Parameters:
        value - the value to match
        Returns:
        true is the value in the CBOR stream matches the given value, otherwise false

      • matchString

        public static Predicate<Value> matchString(String value)
        Matches strings against the provided value with case sensitivity. As an optimization, the given value is serialized into a CBOR encoded value and is tried to be matched on a byte-array level, without actually deserializing the CBOR data stream string itself. That provides the query matcher with way better performance. Only in case the byte-array based matching the string is deserialized and matched using String.equals(Object)}.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to match
        Returns:
        true is the value in the CBOR stream matches the given value, otherwise false

      • matchFloat

        public static Predicate<Value> matchFloat(double value)
        Matches any kind of floating point data type (float, double, BigDecimal against the provided value. This method does not support matching against BigDecimal as a user provided value.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to match
        Returns:
        true is the value in the CBOR stream matches the given value, otherwise false

      • matchInt

        public static Predicate<Value> matchInt(long value)
        Matches any kind of integer data type (byte, short, int, long or BigInteger against the provided value. This method does not support matching against BigInteger as a user provided value.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to match
        Returns:
        true is the value in the CBOR stream matches the given value, otherwise false
